title: Augusta County: Alexander H. H. Stuart to Frances Peyton Stuart, January xx, 1861
summary: Alexander H. H. Stuart writes to his daughter, Frances Peyton Stuart, concerning the secession convention and a recent visit by Fanny's aunt and the Misses Peyton. He speculates as to who will be elected to represent Augusta County in the secession convention.
keywords: National Government, Unionism/Secessionism, Women, State Government, Arts/Leisure, American Civil War
